item.title: EasyRsc
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

EasyRSC, the reason people don’t play it is because.

For someone to use EasyRSC, most of the time it probably means they don’t know how to set up the normal RSCD, which means the servers not worth visiting in the first place.

It could be a successful server, just wouldn’t have any web support, or multiple worlds. Like pets said, management would suck.

For someone that knows how to code and could further develop EasyRSC to a great extent and is being serious about it, is also someone who would know how to setup RSCD, and would take the benefits of that simply because they can.

Read full topic

item.title: EasyRsc
item.dc:creator: @Peter Peeter
item.description:
@Peter wrote:

[quote=“pkr!, post:7, topic:290146”][quote author=Peter link=topic=383537.msg2879444#msg2879444 date=1248241230]
EasyRSC is a horrible idea. It’s a good place to start but any server running EasyRSC wont really have a future.
[/quote]

Elaborate plz?

So, what you’re saying is, ANY EasyRSC server, no matter how well-constructed it is, is bound to fail, right? It’s not fair to assume that all EasyRSC servers are fail just because most of the ppl who use that source make shitty servers…

Although, I’d rather have rscd v25 without a login server, that would be nice :)[/quote]

a) It’s meant for a windows machine last I checked.
b) You do not have a proper database.

Yeah sure you can run the server (I doubt it’ll be at a competitive state with 200 users on vs a server with a mysql DB[resources, speed etc]), but that’s it. You can’t really bind multiple systems together to have a proper server.

It is possible to make a good EasyRSC server… but not one that can be managed well.

Read full topic

EasyRSC is a horrible idea. It’s a good place to start but any server running EasyRSC wont really have a future.

Elaborate plz?

So, what you’re saying is, ANY EasyRSC server, no matter how well-constructed it is, is bound to fail, right? It’s not fair to assume that all EasyRSC servers are fail just because most of the ppl who use that source make shitty servers…

Although, I’d rather have rscd v25 without a login server, that would be nice

item.description:
@ownagesbot wrote:

EasyRSC is just rscd… so why wouldn’t people play it? Someone who isn’t great at programming can still have great ideas, and therefore still run a very successful server. (Albeit most likely less technologically advanced).
